intro: Tapeinostemon longiflorus var. australis, commonly known as the Australian tapeinostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. This variant is adapted to the dry and sunny conditions of its native habitat, making it a resilient plant in arid environments.
